Hear Hear.

For top laners - Pick a tank with great engage and learn when to engage.
Mid lane - Try to make sure the other mid lane doesn't become fed and never be an easy target for a gank.
Jungle - Ignore whiny players. You know yourself and how you play and trying to gank because a player is losing to his/her lane opponent often means two kills for the opponent. Learn the best opportunities to gank.
Marksman - The best champions for ADC are ones that have an engage/disengage that you save for critical moments. Lucien, Ezreal and Caitlyn are good examples.
Support - People will beg you to play tanks with CC like Braum and Leona, but I have always been a firm believer in utility as support. Shields, heals and using Maokai's seedlings as temporary wards are what I like.

As an "I'll-do-everything-but-jungle" main, and a solo player, I would say that something helpful is to try to fill a role that your team needs, or set one in champ select. If the team needs engage, pick your best that can do that. If you need insane burst, pick a champ to fit that role. it could even be as simple as seeing your support pick Ali, and go Yasuo in mid or top to complement that.

So can we see Dash's guide on How to Get Carried?

In all seriousness though, I get SO frustrated when I fall really behind and feel like I can't contribute anything, so I'd love some pointers on how I can still help my team.

Usually it's just not dying in lane... Sounds obvious, but like Dash said, players usually go on tilt and try to fight their enemy laner 1v1/2v2 just to die again... and again... and again... Obviously don't be a complete wimp, but ideally you want to take fights you _know_ you can win (when your jungler ganks for example).

As for contributing late game, it depends on the champion, sometimes you'll have to be careful about how you handle things if you're a tank since you're behind, but if you manage to catch back up in gold by farming as a bruiser/carry, then you can probably start dominating people decently (maybe not what you're used to when you're ahead obviously, so you'll still need to be careful, but you wouldn't be useless).

I'm a support main so I'm used to getting carried (:3 and indirectly carrying), but I'm starting the switch to ADC so I can actually get some practice trading and csing and such. I can't tell you how many times I've had my ADC's/supports go super aggressive while we're behind and I just want them (or myself) to farm to catch up. Obviously trading is fine (unless you're super far behind), but trying to set up kills on even grounds is probably not ideal unless they _really_ screwed up in positioning.

I feel like support carries the adc, way more than the adc carries the support
Even as a TERRIBLE adc, if my support is good, then I am good. And if I am support, if I do well, then the adc almost certainly does well

It's mutual. I've had games as a support where I definitely wouldn't have done as well as I did if my ADC was shitty, and likewise there have been games where I've managed to keep my ADC alive long enough to kill both the enemy laners (usually as raka, because she's stupid proof for the most part). But if we both fall behind, then we're sorta screwed as far as carrying goes at least until late game.
